intro: Erica rigens, commonly known as the rigid heath, is a perennial shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained, acidic soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Erica rigens is known for its compact growth habit and is often used in rock gardens or as a border plant. Its flowering period usually occurs in late spring to early summer, adding a splash of color to the landscape.
